msContents.summary: Side 1 (Recto): Title and description of acquisition. Side 2 (Verso): Qur’an 30,1-9 (8).

msItemStruct.note: Text is on both sides. Side 1 (Recto) has 2 lines written in a later, second hand (calligraphic Naskhi). Side 2 (Verso) has 15 lines: Script looks old. General aspect is highly reminiscent of nos. 10-14 in the Chicago Collection and nos. 8 and 40 in the Vatican Library but has less developed use of diacritical marks. Inconsistent vocalization by red dots. Free word division at line-end, no verse division marks. Kufic characters (S.L. Skoss).
Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Ellen W. Harrison Collection

supportDesc.support: 27.0 x 27.5cm. Cream colored, moderately thick parchment. The original width is almost fully preserved except for some damage in the margins; the upper margin is also partially preserved. The lower side is much damaged, especially on the right corner; however, no more lines were presumably written on the original sheet. The extant writing is in fairly good condition, except for some fading in the ink and a small hole in the middle.

provenance.p: Purchased from Professor Bernhard Moritz of Cairo through W.M. Mueller, 1910.
